Subject: [NEAT] Ranking and selection
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=545241983; y=mtxb8dSNeuh9gsYWNMSG7QFeiXXsqjKf9Zatzi6X0KUrcc18Qg

Hi everyone,

I'm a graduate student and am currently using NEAT, and hopef=
ully soon HyperNEAT, for my thesis.

After some searching I found out that,=
 after applying fitness sharing and taking elitism into account, NEAT uses =
fitness proportional selection. This causes some problems for me, because I=
 do not currently always generate positive fitness values where the relativ=
e fitness of the best and worst individual is 'right'.

I am wondering whet=
her anyone has tried using either tournament selection (instead of proporti=
onal selection after fitness sharing) or some sort of ranking method (as an=
 additional step before fitness sharing), like linear or non-linear ranking=
. Using any of these techniques, only the ranking of individuals would beco=
me important, and the selection pressure simply becomes another parameter o=
f the algorithm.

I found some topics about fitness values on this users gr=
oup, but I did not find one that really addressed my question. I'm sorry if=
 this question has been addressed before.

I would also be happy to hear wh=
at you think are good values for the ratio between the fitness of the best =
and worst individual and/or the selective pressure and/or the selection int=
ensity.

Greetings,
Jonathan Merlevede
